that's ok, killall nautilus and lxde desktop should be back
no sudo needed
nautilus: no process killed
do "ps -ef | grep -i nautilus" and see if it's running, make note of the first number, that's the pid, then "kill -9 <pid here>"
or run "xkill" then click the desktop that is not your lxde desktop, see what happens
